title: assigning to interface optimization
body:
by **djadala**: 
Hi,

According to specs, assigning big value to interface allocate memory. I
expect when reassigning to interface same underlying type, memory to be
reused. But simple test show me that memory is allocated every time:

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. http://play.golang.org/p/oBRSw0WFc9

What is the expected output?
allocs : 0

What do you see instead?
allocs : 1

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
i don't know, default for my os/arch 

Which operating system are you using?
linux

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.1.2 linux/amd64

Please provide any additional information below.
go-nuts suggestion to fill issue report:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/Golang-Nuts/GLek5JaHnZ0
